item.title: Committing to Convictions: How 'They' Lets Us Avoid Accountability
item.description: They say eating red meat causes cancer. They’re saying you shouldn’t swim in rivers anymore. They say vaccines cause autism. We’ve all heard these conversational opening gambits before. Big, bold statements that catch the eye and encourage you to jump straight to a hasty conclusion. But why is it that stuff like this is always uttered by them? And just who are they? The truth is that ‘they’ are no one.
